args:
Basileus sets up an ambush to capture Faris.
However, Ryszarda believes in Faris's innocence
and stands in the way. Just then, Faris purifies
the miasma that had taken root in Pinon, and
reveals that she'd been given false memories.
Madame is addressing the villagers right\nnow. If we wait here, Faris is sure to show\nup looking for the sealing stone.
Are we REALLY going to fight him...?
What's best for Faris is for us to stop him.
What's wrong, Gabriel? It's not like you\nto be so glum.
I'm just thinking about Little Pi keeping\nmum about her secret orders. I ought to\nbe celebrating her independence, but...
There's something I just can't put my\nfinger on. Something strange about the\nway she has been acting...
So, you came here after all, Basileus.\nI suspected you'd make an appearance if\nI got near the sealing stone.
I see you linked up with Pinon and the\nothers. Did you beat me to the punch?
Regina's internal investigation has made it\nplain as day that you are plotting to revive\na demon!
...I see. So THAT'S what's going on.

Regina has decreed that I am to deal with
you. Depending on how much of a threat
you pose, I am either to subjugate and
capture you, or to dispose of you entirely.

You killed an innocent villager for your
own selfish aims, which proves there's
little need to hold back against you.
As is my office, I shall administer Her will.
I've got your back, Basileus.\nGabriel, lend me your strength!\nSigil, unleash!
Ryszarda, {player_name},\nyou two flank him so he can't escape!
Taking on two apostles at once is\ndefinitely a hefty task. However...
That was an uncharacteristically crude\nattack. Feeling impatient, I take it?
(Is this right? Can I really just sit\nhere and watch this battle unfold?)
(Pinon and Basileus might be right. \nThere's plenty of circumstantial evidence.\nEven so...)
Your ability to think things through\nlogically is lacking, but your keen\nintuition more than makes up for it.
And that's an ability I DON'T have.\nSo have more confidence in yourself.
(I'm afraid of stepping out of the frying\npan and into the fire, but...I have to!)
Found a gap in your defenses.\nYou're done.
What do you think you're doing?
Something about you all up and deciding\nthat Faris is a villain doesn't sit right!
Evidence against him is mounting.\nWhat is your basis for overturning it?
I don't have any. But I know what my\nintuition is telling me, and it's telling\nthat Faris is innocent!
Step away, Ryszarda. Regina herself has\nproven his guilt through her investigation.
Lower your bow, Pinon! Think about it:\nDid Regina's orders seem truly just to you?
I knew that gut instinct of yours was sharp,\nRyszarda. This wasn't how I planned on it\nall coming out, but—think fast!
NO! Faris, what did you just throw at her?!
A leather bag full of sanctified water.\nI got it ready using the supply I had\non hand while we were separated.

Grant me now the glory of thy name.
Make me as your readied instrument of
salvation before all, and give unto your
consecrated their perfect repose.
Miasma is pouring out of Pinon's body!
Miasma from a sealing stone—one that\nimplants false memories, no less.
Memories that pertain to an investigation\nthat Regina supposedly carried out, as well\nas her subsequent orders to Pinon.
Little Pi has been with me since the\nmoment we infiltrated Paradise.
If Madame had done something to her,\nI would have noticed.
It happened before you even arrived. Think\nback to the story about Madame secretly\nmeeting with a man at the edge of town.
I remember. We heard that he gave\nMadame some kind of present.
That was no mere gift exchange.\nIt was him loaning her a sealing stone.

Before we infiltrated Paradise, that man
made contact with Pinon and implanted
false memories in her. Afterwards, he
returned the sealing stone to Madame.
What?! Then who in the world are\nwe dealing with here?
The woman who saw the meeting\nremembered his face well. She described\nhis features to me in great detail.
And she was killed in order to silence her.\nThat way, no one else could ask her\nfor details about the man's true identity.
Wait! Basileus would never do\nsomething like that!
Basileus is the very model of an apostle!\nLike, even when we were investigating that\nkidnapping case, he... Urgh!
I expect much of you in the years to come.\nDo not let me down.
Sir! I promise I won't, sir!
By the by, I hear your next mission is an\nundercover investigation in Paradise.
I have a parting gift for you, in that case.\nHere, take it.
Is this...a sealing stone?! Why would\nyou give me something like thi—
What...are these memories?\nHow are they running through my mind?
You've been purged of miasma,\nand now your memories have returned.
No... This has to be a joke, right?\nBasileus, tell me you didn't do this.
The memories that have returned to you\nare the truth, Pinon.
Admit it, Basileus.\nTell them you're guilty.
Now that Pinon has her memories back,\nI'll not shame myself by making excuses.
In any case, it would appear I have\nfulfilled my objective.
Urk! What is this sensation?!\nSomething is resonating within me!
That was a scream!\nIt came from the grand hall!
That damned Madame got tired of waiting.
